title: Emma Willis reveals her secrets to getting red carpet ready for the BRIT Awards
text:
Emma Willis reveals her secrets to getting red carpet ready for the BRIT Awards February 23, 2017 by Chloe Best Emma Willis has revealed the products and beauty secrets that went into creating her stunning red carpet look. The Voice presenter started her preparations the night before by pampering with a face mask, but says it typically takes her just a couple of hours to prepare for a big event. Leave a comment 
We've already had a peek at how Emma Willis prepared for her hosting duties at the BRIT Awards on Wednesday evening, and now the TV presenter has revealed the products and beauty secrets that went into creating her stunning red carpet look. Emma started her preparations the night before by pampering with a face mask, but says it typically takes her just a couple of hours to prepare for a big event. A post shared by Emma Willis (@emmawillisofficial) on Feb 22, 2017 at 2:00am PST Emma Willis shared her backstage beauty secrets ahead of the BRITs 
"Head-to-toe it takes me two hours to get ready," she said. "One hour for styling, then another hour for hair and make-up – my make-up artist is a true perfectionist so this usually takes up most of the time." Emma also revealed that she has learned some valuable beauty lessons during her years in front of the camera. "The biggest thing I have learnt is not to overdo make-up – less is more," Emma said. "I used to always go for a heavier eye and nude lip but now I quite like a cleaner eye and a bolder lip – I never do both though." 
STORY: Emma Willis reveals pre-BRITs beauty routine in amusing Instagram photo 
Emma looked incredible in a black Alexander McQueen gown with a jewel embellished neckline for her debut as BRITs co-host alongside Dermot O'Leary . However The Voice host said she likes to have some back up outfits on hand to suit her mood on the day. "I always like to have a few wardrobe options to try to see what I feel best in on the day and so preparation is key – it could be trousers, a dress, or I do love a skirt and top, so I have to be prepared," she said.
